articleContent.title: Chord: 11th in C (Shape: D)
articleContent.content:
# Chord: 11th in C (Shape: D)

## Brief Presentation
The 11th chord in C, using the shape of a D chord, is a rich and complex jazz chord that adds color and depth to musical compositions. It consists of the root note (C), major third (E), perfect fifth (G), dominant 7th (Bb), and 11th note (F). This chord creates a lush and sophisticated sound that can add a sense of tension and resolution to music.

## Notes and Intervals
- C (Root)
- E (Major third)
- G (Perfect fifth)
- Bb (Dominant 7th)
- F (11th)

## Genre and Musical Flavor
The 11th chord in C using the D shape is commonly found in jazz music, where its complex and intricate sound fits well with the genre's harmonically rich compositions. This chord can evoke a sense of sophistication and emotional depth in jazz tunes, adding texture and color to the music. It is often used in jazz ballads, fusion, and contemporary jazz styles to create a modern and harmonically intriguing sound.

## Songs
- "So What" by Miles Davis
- "Maiden Voyage" by Herbie Hancock
- "All Blues" by Miles Davis
